Options Sort I'm grateful for‚Ä¶ Delete Save The tag can't be empty The message body can't be empty Edit Sort & tags By date By likes./gra Tags Everything Tag me (e.g. Friends) What are you grateful for? üôÇ Hey there! Start by writing about something you're grateful for! Widget Notifications Refresh rate 5 minutes 30 minutes Hourly 4 hours 8 hours Twice a day Daily Grateful notes as a notification Show random grateful notes as a permanent notification Share About Gratus Gratus is a simple app to promote good vibes and positivity. It offers a simple interface to encourage to write about the things we're most grateful for.

The feeling of being grateful is often associated with happiness and good mental health. Quoting Dr. Robert Emmons, professor of Psychology at the University of California "There are many things in our lives, both large and small, that we might be grateful about". Gratus will help you remember about these things and make you smile every time you're reminded of them.

Gratus is dedicated to my sister and my girlfriend, for whom I'm very grateful. Daily reminder To write about the things you're most grateful for from your day Reminder alert time What are you grateful for today? Write down what made today special! Security App lock Protect your Gratus notes from prying eyes Set-up a passcode first Save Create a passcode Change your passcode Are you sure you want to delete this note? yes cancel External Storage Write permission is needed to save the pictures you take with Gratus to your device's storage Allow Deny You'll be able to use your fingerprint to unlock. The passcode is required just in case the fingerprint doesn't work or is inaccessible somehow Info App info Illustrations Superstar doodler Premium version required to use this feature Unlock new features! Unlock amazing features! üòÅ Save your notes to Google Drive and you'll be able to sync it to other devices and never loose them again even if you reset your phone. It's that magical! A handful of beautifully crafted themes to reflect your personality and mood Passcode/fingerprint protection for your personal notes. Don't let anyone read your thoughts but you See your notes every time you swipe through your launcher. It's beautiful Your grateful notes will be able to appear on notifications several times a day to boost your happiness and well being 1 ¬∑ Magical & beautiful notifications 2 ¬∑ A launcher widget for your grateful notes 4 ¬∑ App lock protection üîí 3 ¬∑ 17 amazingly positive themes 5 ¬∑ Google Drive backup & restore Upgrade to get all these magical features üòç You need premium to use this Enter a new 4 to 6 digit passcode Passcode is too small. It needs to be at least 4 digits long Wrong passcode You can't reuse the same passcode Verify your new passcode Passcodes did not match Sign into Gratus Place your finger on the sensor Use passcode Confirm your passcode Are you enjoying Gratus so far? I would love if you could give Gratus a rating on the Play Store! Your suggestions and feedback mean the world to me üòÄ sure not now Want to share feedback that will help make Gratus better? no thanks no Dismissible notification Allows a grateful notification to be dismissed. You'll still be prompted every refresh %1$s Where are my notes being saved to? All the notes you post on Gratus are saved to your device's local storage, private Gratus data directory. They are inaccessible by normal means since Android protects app's private data with SELinux and strict permissions. %1$s How to backup my notes? You can use the Cloud Backup & Restore feature in Settings. It'll use Google Drive to store your notes database and you'll be able to restore it any time or on any device. This feature is only available if you own the Premium version of Gratus. If you don't you can purchase it from Settings %1$s What is the heart/like counter for? It serves two purposes. One is to encourage you to come back to Gratus and re-read older grateful notes and eventually "like" them again. Second is influencing how often notes appear in the notification/widget. More "likes" equal a higher chance on having those notes show up. Also since you can sort the notes list by "likes" instead of date, when you open the app you will see your favorite notes right on top %1$s Why isn't Gratus translated to my language? Translating apps is costly because of the initial investment (lots of words to begin with) but with every update new strings are added that need to be translated (and it costs more money than the one time in-app purchase to unlock all the features). I make use of crowd sourcing and good will of amazing users that use their own free time to translate these strings for free. Eventually the app will be localized into the most common languages. If you want to help send me an e-mail The tag can't have white space(s) Preset themes Themes Pick image Motivational notification A daily "Have a nice day!" message with a beautifully crafted illustration to start your day feeling great and energized! Notification alert time Smile! You need to unlock the premium version to select these beautiful themes Only display notes with pictures I like this! New note Did you know you can protect your thoughts from outside view with a fingerprint/passcode if you upgrade to the premium package? üòè 

Click below to read about it and all the other amazing perks! üåü Yeah, show me! Dismiss Cloud backup & restore Let's start by signing into Google Drive. When it completes you'll be able to backup or restore your notes Sign in Restore a previous backup Backup your current notes Just now Upgrading the database with some pixie dust Backed up %1$s The backup has been successfully restored Some error occurred. Please try again Backing it up‚Ä¶ Oops, some error occurred when backing this up. Try again please Your notes have been successfully backed up üòÅ Backup your grateful notes This will overwrite the previous backup. Backup Restore your older backup Restoring the backup will overwrite all existing data. Restore Syncing‚Ä¶ Google Drive privacy policy Restoring‚Ä¶
